channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for GA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for GA

item.title: Report E-2024020424
item.description:
Report E-2024020424

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-22T15:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-12
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 12, 2024, twenty-four (24) 12-ounce cans of aerosol paint (UN1263) were punctured by a forklift and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the cardboard box and trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. Crews utilized absorbent pads to collect all freestanding product, and any residual material was removed with a degreasing agent. All spent absorbent pads and impacted cardboard were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum, and the damaged cans were collected and containerized into one (1) additional 55-gallon drum. The drums were properly labeled and possession of the material was taken by R+L for disposal through their bulk waste stream.

item.title: Report E-2024020339
item.description:
Report E-2024020339

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-06
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 9, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of corrosive liquid was punctured by a forklift and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the corrosive liquid-impacted roadway and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024020319
item.description:
Report E-2024020319

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T00:33:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-26
  • City: DALTON
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Landstar contracted ERTSr to request help with a spill inside of a trailer at First Source Worldwide, located at 413 Virgil Dr. in Dalton, GA. The spill consists of approximately 3 cups of UN1797 Ammonium bifluoride, solid (trade name unknown), which released from a torn 55 pound paper bag. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors were informed that 3 cups of AMMONIUM HYDROGEN DIFLUORIDE SOLID (UN1727, 8, II) was released from (1) 55-pound bag. Facility personnel cleaned the release and will manage all waste generated.
